channel.title: CVE Feed for Omron -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Omron -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-26417|2024-08-03T05:03:32.822Z -- omron -- cx-position
item.description: Omron CX-Position (versions 2.5.3 and prior) is vulnerable to a use after free memory condition while processing a specific project file, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-26022|2024-08-03T04:56:36.910Z -- omron -- cx-position
item.description: Omron CX-Position (versions 2.5.3 and prior) is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds write while processing a specific project file, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-45794|2024-08-03T14:17:04.073Z -- omron -- cj-series%20and%20cs-series%20cpu%20modules
item.description: An attacker with network access to the affected PLC (CJ-series and CS-series PLCs, all versions) may use a network protocol to read and write files on the PLC internal memory and memory card.

item.title: CVE-2022-26419|2024-08-03T05:03:32.898Z -- omron -- cx-position
item.description: Omron CX-Position (versions 2.5.3 and prior) is vulnerable to multiple stack-based buffer overflow conditions while parsing a specific project file, which may allow an attacker to locally execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-45793|2024-08-03T14:17:04.086Z -- omron -- sysmac%20studio
item.description: Sysmac Studio installs executables in a directory with poor permissions. This can allow a locally-authenticated attacker to overwrite files which will result in code execution with privileges of a different user.

item.title: CVE-2022-3398|2024-08-03T01:07:06.695Z -- omron -- cx-programmer
item.description: OMRON CX-Programmer 9.78 and prior is vulnerable to an Out-of-Bounds Write, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-2979|2024-08-03T00:53:00.516Z -- omron -- cx-programmer
item.description: Opening a specially crafted file could cause the affected product to fail to release its memory reference potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-45790|2024-08-03T14:17:04.118Z -- omron -- cj-series%20and%20cs-series%20cpu%20modules
item.description: The Omron FINS protocol has an authenticated feature to prevent access to memory regions. Authentication is susceptible to bruteforce attack, which may allow an adversary to gain access to protected memory. This access can allow overwrite of values including programmed logic.

item.title: CVE-2022-21137|2024-08-03T02:31:59.760Z -- omron -- cx-one
item.description: Omron CX-One Versions 4.60 and prior are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow while processing specific project files, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-3396|2024-08-03T01:07:06.510Z -- omron -- cx-programmer
item.description: OMRON CX-Programmer 9.78 and prior is vulnerable to an Out-of-Bounds Write, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-45792|2024-08-03T14:17:04.101Z -- omron -- sysmac%20studio
item.description: Project files may contain malicious contents which the software will use to create files on the filesystem. This allows directory traversal and overwriting files with the privileges of the logged-in user.

item.title: CVE-2022-25959|2024-08-03T04:56:36.490Z -- omron -- cx-position
item.description: Omron CX-Position (versions 2.5.3 and prior) is vulnerable to memory corruption while processing a specific project file, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2022-3397|2024-08-03T01:07:06.652Z -- omron -- cx-programmer
item.description: OMRON CX-Programmer 9.78 and prior is vulnerable to an Out-of-Bounds Write, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.
